intro: Sagenia sinuata, commonly known as the sinuous sage, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, sinuous leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
